column1: COMBINER steps follow the same mechanism as those in the algorithm of CITATION
column2: and LINK steps work analogously to those of CITATION
column3: so this schema can be seen as being intermediate between those two algorithms

column1: ) items are called correct (final) items in the original formulation by CITATION
By generalizing the linking steps in Eisner and Sattas parser so that the head of each item can be in any position
column2: we obtain an O(n5 ) parser which can be filtered into the parser of CITATION by eliminating the COMBINER steps

column1: 3 Derivable items are called valid items in the original formulation by CITATION
When described for head automaton grammars CITATION
column2: this algorithm appears to be more complex to understand and implement than the previous one
column3: requiring four different kinds of items to keep track of the state of the automata used by the grammars

column1: 3.1 CITATION One of the most straightforward projective dependency parsing strategies was introduced by CITATION
column2: and is based on the CYK bottomup parsing strategy (Kasami 1965; Younger 1967)
